{ get_plugin_pref_frame, 0, NULL,

memberdef.name: info
memberdef.initializer:
{ PURPLE_PLUGIN_MAGIC, PURPLE_MAJOR_VERSION, PURPLE_MINOR_VERSION, PURPLE_PLUGIN_STANDARD, NULL, 0, NULL, PURPLE_PRIORITY_DEFAULT,
PLUGIN_ID, "G15Purple", VERSION, "Displays information on a G15 lcd", "G15 plugin for libpurple", "Andrew Nagle <kabili207@gmail.com>", "http://zyrenth.homelinux.com",
plugin_load, plugin_unload, NULL,
NULL, NULL, &prefs_info, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL }

detaileddescription.para: Creates window to set pugin options.

parameterdescription.para: The plugin which the option window is for.

simplesect.para: Returns the frame which will display the option window.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the value of t to the current time. The format of the current time is determined by user's settings.

parameterdescription.para: The variable which will be modified.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the value of proto_icon to reflect the protocol of the buddy.

parameterdescription.para: Buddy who's protocol is to be determined

detaileddescription.para: Draws the date stored in the global variables g15message and g15title. Originally, this was to be one of many screens, however that functionality could not be created due to a combination how purple plugins are created (it's not thread-safe) and my novice skills as a C programmer.

parameterdescription.para: The G15 canvas which the data will be rendered to.
The G15 canvas which the data will be rendered to.
The G15 canvas which the data will be rendered to.

memberdef.argsstring: (PurpleAccount *account, const gchar *sender, const gchar *message, int flags, gpointer data)

memberdef.argsstring: (PurpleAccount *account, const gchar *sender, const gchar *message, PurpleConversation *conv, gpointer data)
memberdef.name: notify_chat_nick

detaileddescription.para: Actions to be performed when plugin is unloaded

xrefdescription.para: Attempting to free() canvas causes libpurple to crash. Valgrind reports this as an attempt to free() canvas twice. Unsure if this means libpurple or g15daemon does this automatically.
